N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2212.1 - Eligibility criteria

State Regulations
(a) Awards
shall be available under this Part to all individuals selected as recipients by
the New York State Department of Health who meet the eligibility criteria set
forth in the regulations of the New York State Department of Health in 10 NYCRR
Part
47
and who, in addition, fulfill the criteria set forth in this

Part. (b) Application. Award
recipients shall fulfill the criteria regarding applications set forth in
section
2201.1
(a) of this

Title. (c) Full-time study. Award
recipients shall fulfill the criteria applicable to full-term study set forth
in section
2201.1
(f) of this

Title. (d) Good academic standing. Failure to maintain good academic standing, as defined by the commissioner in
section
145-2.2
of this Title, shall be
grounds for the suspension of an award recipient's eligibility to receive
payments for an award, until such award recipient is reinstated in good
academic standing in accordance with standards established pursuant to section
145-2.2
of this Title. (e) Guaranteed student loan exclusion. Notwithstanding the fulfillment of all eligibility requirements set forth in
this section, any award recipient who is in default of the repayment of a
student loan guaranteed by the corporation, or who has failed to fulfill a
professional service requirement of any award made pursuant to this Subchapter, shall not be eligible to receive payment for any award made under this

Subchapter for so long as such default status continues, or unless and until
the award recipient has made arrangement satisfactory to the president for the
repayment of such student loan. Notes
